snippet: South African police fired rubber bullets at striking farm workers who set up barricades and threw stones on Wednesday in a province whose vineyards are vital to the wine industry.
abstract: South African police fire rubber bullets at striking Western Cape Province farm workers who set up barricades and threw stones; regional vineyards are vital to wine industry in country; labor unrest has spread across various sectors of economy in past year, underscoring growing frustration with vast inequalities of wealth and slow pace of economic progress.
lead_paragraph: South African police fired rubber bullets at striking farm workers who set up barricades and threw stones on Wednesday in a province whose vineyards are vital to the wine industry.

headline.main: South Africa: Unrest in the Vineyards
headline.print_headline: South Africa: Unrest in the Vineyards
